'Revert to an older installation of composer'
'Delete old backups during an update. This makes the current version of composer the only backup available after the update'
'Force an update to the stable channel'
'Force an update to the preview channel'
'Force an update to the snapshot channel'
'Force an update to the stable channel, but only use 1.x versions'
'Force an update to the stable channel, but only use 2.x versions'
'Force an update to the stable channel, but only use 2.2.x LTS versions'
'Only store the channel as the default one and then exit'
The <info>self-update</info> command checks getcomposer.org for newer
versions of composer and if found, installs the latest.
// trigger autoloading of a few classes which may be needed when verifying/swapping the phar file
// to ensure we do not try to load them from the new phar, see https://github.com/composer/composer/issues/10252
// check if current dir is writable and if not try the cache dir from settings
// check for permissions in local filesystem before start connection process
'" directory used to download the temp file could not be written'
// check if composer is running as the same user that owns the directory root, only if POSIX is defined and callable
// if requesting stable channel and no specific version, avoid automatically upgrading to the next major
// simply output a warning that the next major stable is available and let users upgrade to it manually
'<warning>A new stable major version of Composer is available ('
'" to update to it. See also https://getcomposer.org/'
// promote next major version if available in preview
'<warning>A preview release of the next major version of Composer is available ('
'), run "composer self-update --preview" to give it a try. See also https://github.com/composer/composer/releases for changelogs.</warning>'
' is the latest stable version. Updating to it via composer self-update --stable is recommended.</warning>'
' is the latest stable version. Updating to it via composer self-update --stable is recommended.</warning>'
'<error>You can not update to a specific SHA-1 as those phars are not available for download</error>'
'<info>You are already using the latest available Composer version %s (%s channel).</info>'
// remove all backups except for the most recent, if any
'<error>The download of the new composer version failed for an unexpected reason</error>'
'<warning>Skipping phar signature verification as you have disabled OpenSSL via config.disable-tls</warning>'
'The openssl extension is required for phar signatures to be verified but it is not available. '
'If you can not enable the openssl extension, you can disable this error, at your own risk, by setting the \'disable-tls\' option to true.'
'SHA384 is not supported by your openssl extension, could not verify the phar file integrity'
// PHP 8 automatically frees the key instance and deprecates the function
'The phar signature did not match the file you downloaded, this means your public keys are outdated or that the phar file is corrupt/has been modified'
'<warning>A backup of the current version could not be written to '
'Public keys can not be fetched in non-interactive mode, please run Composer interactively'
'Enter Dev / Snapshot Public Key (including lines with -----): '
'Composer rollback failed: no installation to roll back to in "'
* Checks if the downloaded/rollback phar is valid then moves it
* @param string $newFilename The downloaded or backup phar
* @param string $backupTarget The filename to use for the backup
* @throws FilesystemException If the file cannot be moved
* @return bool Whether the phar is valid and has been moved
'<error>Please re-run the self-update command to try again.</error>'
// copy current file into backups dir
// use copy to apply permissions from the destination directory
// as rename uses source permissions and may block other users
// see if we can run this operation as an Admin on Windows
* @param string $pharFile The downloaded or backup phar
* @param null|string $error Set by method on failure
* Code taken from getcomposer.org/installer. Any changes should be made
// Free the variable to unlock the file
* Returns true if this is a non-admin Windows user account
// fltmc.exe manages filter drivers and errors without admin privileges
* Invokes a UAC prompt to update composer.phar as an admin
* Uses a .vbs script to elevate and run the cmd.exe copy command.
* @param string $newFilename The downloaded or backup phar
* @return bool Whether composer.phar has been updated
'Please run the self-update command as an Administrator.'
// cmd's internal copy is fussy about backslashes
